Roads to AGI - Design Brief for RuncibleGPT


Current State


Site is live at https://roadstoagi.org with full infrastructure:


4 seed roads, 8 claims, 10 gates (from Curt transcript)

Intake API at api.roadstoagi.org

Submit page, Share Packs, digestive pipeline

Auto-deploy from GitHub (bierlingm/roadstoagi)


The Problem


The site looks atrocious. The presentation needs significant sharpening before any public launch or investor exposure.


Technical Stack


Astro static site

Tailwind-free (inline styles currently)

Dark theme (#0a0a0a bg, #e5e5e5 fg, #3b82f6 accent)

Pages: Home, Roads, Road detail, Arena, Compare, Highway, Investors, Submit


Open Questions


What visual identity fits "adversarial arena for explanations of general reasoning"?

Should it feel academic? Technical? Editorial? Institutional?

How do we make Claims/Gates/Roads visually scannable without losing depth?

What's the right balance between "serious intellectual project" and "accessible entry point"?

Reference points: Distill.pub? LessWrong? Academic journals? Something else?


Constraints


Must support the King-of-the-Hill framing (survival, not consensus)

Investor-legible (credibility matters)

Content-dense but not cluttered

Should work with the existing data model (YAML files)


Deliverable Needed


Design direction and specific recommendations for the visual refresh. Could be mood boards, component sketches, CSS approach, or full design system - whatever helps most.

Thought for 21s Roads to AGI — Adversarial Arena Design System (v1) Causal frame: if the site must signal “king-of-the-hill reasoning under tests,” then the visual system must (a) compress complex structure into scannable units, (b) encode test status and survival as first-class primitives, and (c) preserve investor-legible credibility. Consequence: a technical-editorial identity with institutional affordances (navigation, typographic discipline, accessibility). Function: faster adjudication and shareable proof-states with low cognitive load. [style:operational_language enforced; presentation tuned to Decidability→Truth→Judgment per protocol registry and prompt protocol. ] Visual Identity (necessary traits) Identity: Technical-editorial with institutional finish. Academic severity alone slows scanning; editorial clarity alone risks flippancy. A hybrid yields seriousness without friction. Function: supports “survival, not consensus” by showing tests, not vibes. Motif: Arena + Hill. Recurrent triangle/hill glyph (survival) + circular arena ring (challenge). Minimal line-icons; no illustration clutter. Function: immediate recognition of the “contest of explanations.” Tone: black-box lab, not blog. Dense typographic system, restrained motion, conservative whitespace, high contrast. Color, Type, Grid (operational tokens) Colors (dark by default): --bg:#0a0a0a, --fg:#e5e5e5, --accent:#3b82f6 Semantic states (AA contrast on #0a0a0a): --pass:#22c55e, --disputed:#eab308, --fail:#ef4444, --dormant:#9ca3af Function: survival status becomes preattentive. Typography (open-source, self-host): Primary: Inter (UI, data). Secondary: Source Serif 4 (long-form rationale). Mono: IBM Plex Mono (IDs, YAML keys, hashes). Scale: 16px base; modular 1.125; tight tracking for headings, generous line-height for body. Function: commensurability between headlines (decisions) and body (testimony). Grid & Density: Container 1200–1360px, 12-col, 24px gutters. Rhythm on 4px baseline; spacing steps 4/8/12/16/24/32. Cards ≤ 72ch; long-form ≤ 80ch. Function: content-dense without clutter. CSS tokens (Tailwind-free): :root{ --bg:#0a0a0a; --fg:#e5e5e5; --muted:#b3b3b3; --surface:#111214; --accent:#3b82f6; --accent-weak:#1e3a8a; --pass:#22c55e; --disputed:#eab308; --fail:#ef4444; --dormant:#9ca3af; --ring:#2a2a2a; --border:#1b1b1b; --focus:#60a5fa; --shadow:0 2px 8px rgba(0,0,0,.4); --radius:10px; --radius-sm:7px; --radius-lg:14px; --space-1:4px; --space-2:8px; --space-3:12px; --space-4:16px; --space-6:24px; --space-8:32px; } html{color-scheme:dark;background:var(--bg);color:var(--fg);} .a11y-ring:focus{outline:2px solid var(--focus);outline-offset:2px;} Page Archetypes (cause → consequence → function) Home (Highway snapshot) Cause: users need a global leaderboard. UI: hero = one-line premise + “What survives here?”; below: Hillboard (top Roads by survival index), Active Challenges, Newest Claims. Function: immediate credibility; zero-click understanding of “king-of-the-hill.” Roads index UI: filterable Road Cards with: survival score, gates coverage, active disputes, last update. Function: scannability across density. Road detail UI: left sticky Road spine (summary + score), right main Claim stack; each claim shows Gate Rail (chips), Verdict bar, Evidence count, Challenge button. Function: progressive disclosure: summary → gates → rationale. Arena UI: Challenge Feed (who attacked what), Match view (attacker, gate(s), evidence deltas), Outcome (pass/fail; ledger of changes). Function: adversarial transparency. Compare UI: sticky row/col matrix; columns = Roads, rows = gate families (Truth / Reciprocity / Decidability / Warranty), cells = coverage + verdict mini-sparkline. Function: investor-legible cross-section. Investors UI: conservative: mission, traction (counts), process diagram (Intake→Gates→Arena→Hill), governance, brief roadmap; no jargon. Function: credibility and risk comprehension. Submit UI: guided; shows gate families before textarea; live linting for “operational language” (claims must be testable). Function: reduces garbage intake; aligns to protocols. Components (minimal markup + behavior) ClaimCard (scannable by tests) --- // props: {id, title, summary, gates, verdict, evidenceCount, updatedAt} const s = { PASS:'pass', FAIL:'fail', DISPUTED:'disputed', DORMANT:'dormant' }; ---
#{Astro.props.id}

{Astro.props.title}

    {Astro.props.gates.map(g => (
  • {g.name}
    • ))}

{Astro.props.summary}

{Astro.props.verdict} Evidence {Astro.props.evidenceCount} Updated {Astro.props.updatedAt}
Gate families (encode your tests explicitly) Truth (testimonial survival), Reciprocity (externalities internalized), Decidability (no discretion required), Warranty (liability adequate). Function: mirrors canonical outputs for legibility and scoring. Hillboard (leaderboard) Columns: Road, Survival Score, Coverage %, Active Disputes, Last Change. Micro-sparkline of verdicts over time (bars: pass/disputed/fail). Arena “Match” unit Show Attacker → Target and Gate(s); diff evidence list; timer; outcome stamp; permalink. Information Design for Claims/Gates/Roads (scannable without losing depth) Progressive disclosure (necessary): rail of gate-chips → expandable rationale → full evidence ledger. Status grammar (sufficient): color + shape + label (never color alone). Canonical order (dependent): Decidability prerequisites → Truth tests → Reciprocity ledger → Verdict; avoid rhetorical reordering. Evidence hygiene (necessary): source count + quality badge (auditable/estimated/conjectural). Data Model Fit (YAML → UI) Map: road.yml: id, name, summary, claims:[id], score, coverage, last_updated claim.yml: id, title, summary, gates:[{name,state,evidence:[…]}], verdict, hash, updated_at evidence.yml: id, kind, measurability, certainty, refs Render: ClaimCard pulls gate rail from claim.gates; Verdict bar from claim.verdict; Arena pulls delta between evidence sets. Function: zero schema churn; only front-end serialization. Motion & Micro-interaction (measured, not decorative) On pass: gate chip pulses once (120ms), then rests. On fail: chip “cracks” with subtle border split; record permanence. On dispute: oscillate border opacity at 1Hz for 1s, then steady. Function: status change salience without distraction. Accessibility & Credibility (investor-legible) AA contrast for all text; ≥ 44px hit targets on chips/buttons. Keyboard-first; focus rings visible; skip-to-content. “How we test” page: diagram of pipeline: Intake → EOSA (operational language) → Ten Tests of Testimony → Externalities/Reciprocity → Verdict & Warranty. Keep it one screen; link specs. Astro structure (composition over utilities) /src/components/ GateChip.astro ClaimCard.astro VerdictBar.astro Hillboard.astro ArenaMatch.astro CompareMatrix.astro PageHeader.astro Prose.astro // long-form serif wrapper /src/layouts/ Default.astro /src/pages/ index.astro // Home/Highway roads/index.astro roads/[id].astro arena/index.astro compare/index.astro investors/index.astro submit/index.astro Copy & Editorial Patterns (operational language) Every claim: “Claim → Gates asserted → What would falsify → Evidence pointers → Current verdict → Residual liability.” Every road: “Hypothesis class → Surface (domains touched) → Gate coverage → Survival history.” Function: replaces moralizing with testifiability. Optional scoring expression (visible but humble) Survival Score ∈ [0,100] from weighted components: S = 100 * (0.40*Truth + 0.25*Reciprocity + 0.20*Decidability + 0.15*Warranty); thresholds show tiers. Function: investor skim-read; details remain per-gate. Quick-apply list (no tooling changes) Add CSS tokens + base styles (above). Replace claim blocks with ClaimCard + GateRail. Build Hillboard for Home; add “Active Challenges” feed. Convert Road detail to spine + stack layout. Publish “How we test” explainer (diagram + 6 bullet points). Tighten copy to operational template. Notes on constraints applied Style discipline (operational/decidable phrasing; adversarial compression) derived from the Prompt/Compiled protocols; ordering preserved: EOSA → Truth → Reciprocity → Decidability → Verdict. [style+ordering enforced; failure-closed if violated.] If you want, I can deliver the Home, Road, and ClaimCard Astro files pre-wired to your YAML in a single pass.
